refnamediv.refpurpose: Puts the value of the i-time expression into a k-, a-rate or t- variable.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Put the value of the i-time expression into a k- or a-rate variable.

refsect1.title: Initialization
refsect1.para: Puts the value of the i-time expression iarg into a k-, a-rate or t- variable, i.e., initialize the result. Note that init provides the only case of an init-time statement being permitted to write into a perf-time (k- or a-rate) result cell; the statement has no effect at perf-time.

Since version 5.13 it is possible to initialise upto 24 variables of the same class in one statement. If there are more output variables than input expressions then the last one is repeated. It is an error to have more inputs than outputs.
The t-variable form was introduced in 5.14 and allocated space for a vector or the given size, initialised to the given value (default value is zero).
